head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: Union Drive At Uniform Maker

identified-content.org: Union of Needletrades, Industrial and Textile Employees

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: Union Drive At Uniform Maker

body.head.byline: By Steven Greenhouse (NYT) (Compiled by Anthony Ramirez)

abstract.p: Union of Needletrades, Industrial and Textile Employees is hoping to unionize Cintas Corp, leading maker of uniforms; Cintas has 17,000 employees (S)

block.p: A textile workers' union said yesterday that it hoped to unionize the Cintas Corporation, the leading maker of uniforms for hotels, airlines and other businesses. The Union of Needletrades, Industrial and Textile Employees said the drive was one of its largest, an effort to organize 17,000 Cintas workers. At a City Hall news conference, Bruce Raynor, the union's president, said the union hoped to organize 300 Cintas sites in the United States and Canada. The union filed charges yesterday accusing Cintas, based in Cincinnati, of violating federal labor laws at 36 plants in New York, Newark, Hartford and 14 other cities. Cintas officials said they comply with the law.
